catalogue_raissonne: Hind 31 i/iii; B. 13; Mz.7 i/iii; Holl. 13 i/iii; B-B. 30-N i/iii
markings:
Verso: British Museum register number stamp in black ink (L. 303): 1855-4-14-259
Verso: British Museum Duplicate stamp in brown ink (L. 305, initialed by Sydney Colvin)
Verso: \"GLB\", unidentified (L. 1172b).
provenance: British Museum, London, register numer 1855-4-14-259, BM Duplicate stamp in brown verso (L. 305, initialed by Sydney Colvin); black stamp verso (L. 303); "GLB", unidentified (L. 1172b).
text: The first state is a rich, early trial proof taken before Rembrandt had trimmed and smoothed the edges of the copper plate. Such rarities are highly prized by collectors. Rembrandt's final compositional solution increased the amount of the image devoted to his own face, thus pushing him more aggressively into the viewer's space.
title: Self-Portrait as if Shouting
